Julia - A Brief Introduction

  31 Jan 2015

Declaring variables 

x = 8
show(x)

8

Arithmetic 

x = 8
y = 7
print(x)
print(y)
print(x+y)

8715

Wait, what happened here? The output of x,y,x+y is mashed together. How to fix this? 

x = 8
y = 7
print(x,"\n")
print(y,"\n")
print(x+y,"\n")

8
7
15

While it may be someone cumbersome to type the newline character "\n" everytime, this setup helps keep your output customizable.

Lets, define our own class. This class will be based on modular arithmetic. 

type ModType{n}
    x::Int
    ModeType(x::Int) = new(mod(x,n))
end

x=ModType{2}(6)
print(x)

print(1:5,"\n")
print([i for i=1:5],"\n")
print([trace(rand(n,n)) for n=1:5],"\n")

1:5
[1,2,3,4,5]
[0.8916302205258944,1.019999104111116,1.1279886971149247,2.46252055445864,2.0767146111883976]
